text: Kipkurui Misoi (born 23 October 1978 in Bomet) is a retired Kenyan long- distance runner who specialized in the 3000 metres steeplechase. == Achievements == {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1996 |World Junior Championships |Sydney, Australia |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |3000 m st. |8:33.31 |- |rowspan=2|1998 |World Cross Country Championships |Marrakech, Morocco |align="center" | 8th |Short race (4 km) |11:10 |- |Commonwealth Games |Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia |bgcolor=cc9966 align="center" | 3rd |3000 m st. |8:18.24 |- |rowspan=2|1999 |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |bgcolor=gold align="center" | 1st |3000 m st. |8:32.42 |- |IAAF Grand Prix Final |Munich, Germany |align="center" | 4th |3000 m st. |8:11.36 |- |2001 |IAAF Grand Prix Final |Melbourne, Australia |align="center" | 4th |3000 m st. |8:19.01 |- |2004 |World Athletics Final |Monte Carlo, Monaco |align="center" | 4th |3000 m st. |8:12.99 |- |2005 |World Athletics Final |Monte Carlo, Monaco |align="center" | 8th |3000 m st. |8:21.01 |} ===Personal bests=== *1500 metres - 3:39.17 min (1998) *3000 metres - 7:40.93 min (2000) *5000 metres - 13:26.83 min (1998) *3000 metre steeplechase - 8:01.69 min (2001) ==External links== * Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Kenyan male middle- distance runners Category:Kenyan male long-distance runners Category:Kenyan male steeplechase runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1998 Commonwealth Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in athletics Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for Kenya Category:African Games gold medalists for Kenya Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Kenyan male cross country runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1999 All-Africa Games
title: Kipkurui Misoi
